reference.title: API Keys
reference.shortdesc: An API key is a unique string that identifies and authenticates your requests to the HelioNote REST API. Every request must include a valid API key to ensure secure access to your account data.

section.title: Obtaining an API Key
section.p: To get an API key, sign in to your HelioNote developer account and navigate to the API Keys section in the dashboard. From there, you can generate a new key or manage existing ones.

section.title: Using an API Key
section.p: Include your key in the Authorization header of every request, using the following format:

ul.li: Never share your API keys publicly or expose them in client-side code.
Rotate keys regularly to reduce security risks.
If a key is compromised, revoke it immediately and generate a new one.
Restrict keys to specific environments or IPs whenever possible.
Invalid key: Ensure you copied the key correctly.
Missing key: Add the Authorization header to your request.
